runs.comm: a hint of away movement, which Warner negotiates well by getting back and across on off stump. Safely defended
a little shortish, but in the corridor again. Warner gets in line and defends with far softer hands than he's known for
opens the face when he meets the back of a length ball and pushes it through extra cover. Neatly done

beaut! That's the Anderson special, hammers into the uncertain length where the batsmen doesn't know if he wants to go forward or back. Finch is stuck in the crease and wafts outside off. Handsomely beaten

dropped by Woakes, was it? Was he the man at midwicket? Yep. It was the inswinger, slid in full and on middle, Finch goes for a flick and forgets to keep it down. Woakes leaps up and has to get the reverse cups going over his head, and fluffs it! That was simple, by international standards
shortish and outside off, belted to mid-off as Finch moves deep in his crease
back of a length and outside off, tapped towards mid-off
tries to cramp him up on middle and leg, Warner uses the line and nudges it off his hips to long leg
full and slanted in at Finch, good that he managed to get the inside edge on that otherwise he would've been quite adjacent. Flick to long leg gets him a couple
gets it to straighten outside off and nails a good length too, Finch respects it with a block
beaten again! Fishes the extravagant drive through the covers as he bowls full and jags the ball away at the very last moment. Might as well pinned a 'ha ha' note on that ball
another awayswinger, perhaps a touch wider which means Finch can correct his mistake from the last ball and leave it
good length on off stump, defended strongly to mid-off
fullish and outside off, dragging him to play the angle across him and beats him. Terrific fast bowling
back of a length on off stump, defended cautiously
he's not been put off from coming forward, and he has to with Jimmy keeping the ball full on off stump. Pushed towards mid-off
rare loose ball, and Warner has picked it away through midwicket to pick up a couple. A tad too straight from Jimmy, perhaps looking for the inswinger as a change up
just back of a length and skimming over what would have been sixth stump, Warner lets it pass
phew! How's that to blunt the fast bowler's confidence (and get some for yourself)? Takes a fullish delivery and lifts it over mid-on with pure authority

predictable response, and even if Finch was ready for the short ball he is not able to time it well enough. Good short ball from Broady which rose around chest-high and came at him quite quickly too. Miscue finds the gap and gets him three
shortish on middle and leg, Warner hops back and short-arm flicks it almost all the way to the square leg boundary. It's the long one down there, and Ballance is able to catch up with it
muscled away to the square leg boundary! Vicious! Bowling short with the new ball, especially when he offers enough room for Finch to free his arms and hammer a pull with pure abandon
fuller delivery on middle and leg, flicked to long leg. Better length
hit him on the hip, I think... It was shortish, and quick as well. Warner attempts to push it into the off side but it jags back late, takes the inside edge and has probably caused a bruise
looks for swing, but all he can find is Finch's sweet spot! Gets that front foot down the ground and pounds a drive to the left of the bowler
back of a length and outside off, refusing Finch the drive he has been quite keen on, punched to mid-off
goes wide of the crease and Finch exploits the angle into the pads with a flick to the left of long leg, I'm kinda digging these larger outfields
slips a bit too far down leg as Anderson searches for the inswinger
stands up on his toes to get on top of a shortish ball and slaps it through th ecovers. Taylor aand Morgan chase after it and keep it to three. Long boundaries for the win, again

full, slashed, mid-off dives and might have gotten his fingertips to it. <s>Taylor</s> Sorry, Moeen was the man who dives to his left, but it was struck a bit too hard. Seemed like an escape shot from Warner as he saw the length full and a bit of width
fuller on off stump, caressed down the ground. Don't use that word too often with Warner, but this was just a solid push

fullish on off stump, Finch taps it towards mid-on. Broad dives, and more importantly Warner takes a tumble as he responds to his partner taking a couple of steps down! Finch says "no" though and a run-out on the cards, but Bell at short midwicket doesn't get across and Anderson can't get there quick enough
back of a length on off stump, blocked to short midwicket
full and wide outside off, Finch throws his hands at it and finds a single to third man

inside edge! But he's safe! And that's top work from Ballance on the long-leg boundary. Races across and flicks the ball back with his left hand. It was a good length ball, which cramps Warner for room and his open face does not amount to a pretty shot. But he gets runs anyway
full on middle and leg, flicked away strongly towards square leg where Woakes dives to his right and keeps it to nothing
good length ball on middle and leg, possibly a slower one as well. Wanders away down leg as FInch attempts a flick
shortish on middle and leg, nudged behind square leg
shortish on middle and leg, Finch skips inside the line and tickles it quite fine. That's Australia's fifty and it's the result of their batsmen whacking England's seamers off their lengths
back of a length on off stump, defended under his eyes
hits him on his stomach as Finch tries to work a shortish delivery across the line and gets a hit
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
shortish on off stump, defended cautiously
jumps inside the line and flicks a shortish delivery off his hips behind square leg and retains strike
shortish and a shade outside off, pulled off one leg to long leg. Say that five times fast!

that's mauled! It might have been a tad short, but the shot it got was quite emphatic. He was on the front foot, swung that big blade and walloped it over deep square leg as Broad's shoulder's slump in his followthrough

searing in at Warner and his stumps are toppled! It was the cross-seamer, like the previous ball, only it still manages to swing. Beats him for pace, beats him for movement and sends him back. Big strike for England, and what was the length?

it just had to happen, right? MCG, big, raucous crowd, Broad is in his element! Terrific length and the line is impeccable on off stump. Brings the batsman forward and jags the ball away, steals the outside edge and the keeper does the rest. England are right back in it!
full and targeting the bast of off stump and Smith was moving across to try and flick it away. Corrects himself just in time and blocks with a less of a closed bat and saves himself

top-class bouncer now and there's an extravagant appeal from Broad and Buttler. Morgan joins them in the discussion for a review, but he doesn't think it merits one. Beats Smith for pace and the line of the short ball was a shade outside off too, meaning Smith, who had gone for the pull, had to drag the ball. Fails to make any contact, presumably
full and curling in on middle and leg, blocked just about as Finch decides not to close his bat at the last minute
shortish and Finch leaps off his feet and cuts past Morgan and point and gets a couple of runs before Taylor catches up with it
shortish on off stump again, Finch tucks it towards long leg
good length ball outside off, Smith lunges forward and shoulders arms
shortish on middle and leg, tapped towards mid-on
fullish delivery outside off, Smith steps forward with a defensive bat
outside edge as Finch is opened up! But Australa get the benefit of it because Finch is quick enough for two. Good length ball shapes away quite late and had him in a bit of bother
fullish on middle and leg, nudged into midwicket
fullish and outside off, Smith shuffles across as he so often does and clips it towards the midwicket region
cramped for room, so Finch has to stay content with working the back of a length delivery to long leg and scamper a couple
banged in short and Finch, having loaded up for a pull, decides to drop his wrists and go safety first. One-bouncer for the over says umpire Dharmasena

another searing bouncer from Broady and Buttler has to stretch himself like elastic to get a hand to that. Finch stares in disbelief at the umpires who rule it a legal ball. And I think they might just be right, it rose sharply after passing the batsman around shoulder/ neck height
who cares for the text book? It's a back of a length ball that might have brought out a pull of a punch through cover. But Smith decides to swat it through wide mid-on
fullish on off stump, Smith wanders outside off to try and block. Was he even blocking? The bat was hidden behind his pad

inswing! Beautiful inswing! Gets the inside edge, knocks into off stump and Smith is on his way. He was moving around the crease a touch too much and the fuller delivery cuts back in to fool his front-foot drive on the up and makes him hear a sound every batsman hates
good length ball a shade outside off, left well alone
clipped off his hips as he enjoys the comfort of staying back and working with the pace of the bowler
fullish on middle and off, but it ends up at long leg because of some inward movement and Finch's flick. Two new balls are fun, aren't they?
a touch too full and Finch has loved the drive today. Finds mid-on
shortish on middle, but Finch has pounced on it. Stays back, lifts his front leg for balance and half-pulls, half-paddles it to the long leg boundary. Magnificent timing
good length ball on off stump, tapped towards short midwicket
uses Finn's pace and bounce and directs him to long leg
fullish on off stump, has Bailey a little uncertain as he keeps to his crease and blocks with an open face
makes him hop with a bit of extra bounce, and just enough pace away. Bailey softens the grip on his bat and weathers it well
shortish and outside off, Finch has cracked it behind point but doesn't trouble third man. Everytime the ball beats the infield, it seems to be two

full and outside off, Finch unveils a gorgeous drive to the left of Stuart Broad, who slips on his way from mid-off. He stops it nonetheless. But not before Finch has gone to fifty off 42 balls, MCG loves him, local boy, isn't he?
shortish on middle and off, defended

ouch! But Taylor's grinning at short leg after taking a whack on his right ankle! Full-blooded pull from Bailey against a short ball outside off and the fielder was crouching as much as he could to escape the blow. No such luck for the poor guy
fullish on off stump, gets Bailey forward for once to block

almost slipped off his feet while he pulls! The camera pans away so I can't see if he did overbalance and yep, he did fall over and nearly ticked the off stump with his back foot, but amid it all he has sent a good bouncer over middle and leg to long leg
opens the face and runs a back of a length ball through point
back of a length on off stump, defended carefully
full and wide outside off, Finch throws his bat at it but can't connect
back of a length and outside off, tapped off the open face to point
shortish on off stump, Finch moves a touch outside the line and nudges it through midwicket
gets in line with a shortish ball that was on and around off stump
works it away from the off stump as he favours the gap through midwicket. Slightly lesser pace from Woakes allows the batsmen that liberty
fullish and outside off, Bailey slices it towards point and can't find the gap
banged in short and Bailey swivels on the back foot and pulls to Moeen at deep midwicket
shortish on off stump, Finch tucks it around the corner to long leg and ensures he doesn't run on the pitch
lovely channel from Woakes as he keeps Bailey to a forward defensive into the off side. Right, lots of cricket has happened. Time for a drinks break
entices the drive and Finch is happy to oblige, mid-off has to run a little to his left to keep that to a single. Broad, I think

Mix up! full on middle and off, Bailey manages to protect his stumps and Finch was launching himself back into the crease to try and save himself. And drops his bat. Bailey hasn't realised it as he simply took off, craving runs in the form he's in, and has to scamper back before mid-off catches up with it
back of a length on off stump, defended
full and a shade wide of off stump, Bailey slices it through point and picks up three. Played that with one hand to try and keep it to ground and benefits from it
shortish on off stump, tapped towards deep square leg
shortish and outside off, slapped away behind point as Bailey feels more of the middle of his bat
short and outside off, Finch has set up for the cut and has timed it sublimely. But Taylor is there and he dives to his left to save a certain boundary. Great work
beautiful drive to a fuller ball on off stump, Broad gets behind it and keeps it to none
fullish on middle, Bailey taps it down the ground, beats the bowler, beats mid-on diving across and secures a single
short and a shade outside off, Finch drags it wit ha pull to deep midwicket
pushes him back with a shortish delivery on middle, Bailey loses his balance for just a second as he pushes to mid-on
gets a little shape back in at Bailey and ruins his off drive, which goes to mid-on instead
runs a shortish delivery past point's left and secures a couple of runs to deep third man. Great intensity from Finch, picked out Moeen, who suddenly realises how far away from the stumps he was
extra bounce for Finn! The batsman was looking to move across and clip the ball through midwicket, but has to resort to a straight bat
good length ball on off stump, defended
opens the face against a fuller delivery outside off and gets a single to deep point
very short and Bailey leaps up and slams the cut down into the ground. Carried to point, but he had placed it just a touch wide of Bell there
moves across on middle and gets struck on the pads! Finn launches a huge appeal, but Dharmasena is unmoved. It was a good length ball that cut back in at the batsman, but did strike him a bit high
fullish delivery outside off, Bailey is forward with a block
takes the leading edge as Bailey was looking to work a good length ball through midwicket. Has to settle for not lobbing the ball one of the close-in fielders on the off side
pushes outside off as JImmy gets the ball to nip away just enough to beat Bailey. He was only half forward there
back of a length and outside off, Bailey continues using the open face and finds point
fullish and curling away on off stump, Bailey lunges forward and pushes to mid-off
short and wide and it doens't matter if you have two points, Bailey's split them with a rasping cut and takes two to the sweeper
struck outside the line, and possibly high too on the lbw appeal. Good length ball, skids and cuts back in at the batsman who was playing a flick
gets forward to defend a good length ball outside off
flatter delivery on off stump, kept out
looks to force the good length ball into the covers, but can't beat the bowler
flighted outside off, pushed to long-on
nips down the ground, but Bailey can't beat the infield on the leg side
good length ball that straightens on off stump, Finch has been there enough to block it
just a shade short and Finch scythes it towards point, neat job opening the face there
fullish on off stump, Finch nudges to mid-on. Run-rate seems to be stuck the last few overs. Less than four in the last five
back of a length on off stump, tapped down the ground

jumps down the track, but Anderson pulls his length back. Finch is not wrongfooted though and manages to pull it down to long leg and race over for a couple. They ran on the throw, that's how difficult it is for the deep fielders
fuller delivery on off stump and Finch hammers it back at the bowler
dinky little paddy for Bailey and he beats long leg comfortably. Moeen is bowling a flatter trajectory and that means more pace on the ball, which the Australia captain exploits
jumps down the track and gets a bit of an edge while trying to flick the ball away. Lucky there's no one close in
fuller delivery outside off, Bailey opens the face as he defends
gets down the ground and taps it to long-on, Root's the man who keeps it to a single
paddle-sweep outbreak! Finch decides to see how low he can go and shovels a length ball from Moeen away to the long leg boundary
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket
good length ball on middle nad leg, clipped away into the leg side

lofts it all the way! Didn't seem like it came off the middle, but it doesn't need to nowaways. does it? Lunges forward in glee after seeing the length full and the line wide and enjoys a six off the bottom of the bat
back of a length on off stump, defended
cramps him up on off stump and Finch clips it to short midwicket
banged in and Finch gets on top of it with a pull and keeps it down to deep square leg
stays beside the shortish ball outside off and runs it to deep third man
flighted on off stump, Bailey works it to the left of short fine leg
leans forward and outside off to tickles the flighted delivery into midwicket
smartly working Moeen right now as Bailey skips down and secures a single to long-on
pulls all the pace off it and loops the ball outside off, Finch presses forward to block. Magnificent flight and drift away
a touch short and Finch uses the pace on it as he waits for it to turn and cuts it late to short third man
backs away and cuts the short ball to point

slugs it to the long-on boundary! No country for part-time spinners. Lunges forward and slog sweeps the first ball from Root, which wasn't all that bat, just a bit of width on offer to let Finch free his arms
good length ball on off stump, defended
another wallop! And it clears the fence this time! Again, it's sliced and it's six. Good length ball on off stump and Finch just decided it had to go and benefits from his own brute strength
flatter delivery on middle and leg, tickled away to square leg
saw Bailey running at him and tried to spear it in at his feet, flicked to short midwicket
good length ball to which he goes back and blocks
waits on the back foot and he's benefited from that big time. Beautiful late cut from Finch as he picks the gap to the right of short third man. Broad has no chance
flighted on off stump, drilled to long-on
steps forward right in front of middle stump and nudges a flighted delivery around his pad to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, lunges forward to defend
fleeting leg-before appeal, but Finch has pressed forward quite far and the impact was a bit outside off too. Good length and flight though
allows the ball to turn and keeps the batsman honest. Finch defends a good length ball that darts in at him on off stump
shortish and outside off, pushed back at the bowler
back of a length and outside off, pushed towards mid-off
banged in short, but the softer ball isn't getting as much zip. Bailey pulls powerfully to deep square leg
fullish delivery outside off, was it slower? Finch gets forward to drop it into the covers and sneak a quick single

there's more evidence of the ball not posing much threat any more. Broad keeps going short, hoping to upset the batsman. But it only rises to the perfect height for Bailey to pummel it away to the midwicket boundary
cuts back in quite sharply and leaves Bailey in an awkward position. He was set up for another slog into the leg side and has to take quick action to protect his stumps
gets to the pitch of the ball and drills it down to long-on
jumps back and sees the good length ball follow him. Moeen's turning it quite nicely now and keeps it to nothing
gets down the track and drives to long-on
stays back to a good length ball and works it to long leg
down the track to take it on the full and Bailey flicks it to the right of Root at long-on
tossed up on off stump, Finch finds midwicket
fullish and outside off, pushed towards mid-off
fuller delivery on off stump, Bailey knocks it down the pitch
sliding down the leg side and Bailey has clipped it off his hips to long leg
fuller delivery outside off, defended back at Broad
fullish on off stump, Finch can only keep it out. Looks like he's adjusted his length to the situation
full toss on the pads, Broad feels good and goes up for an appeal too while the batsmen pick up a single to midwicket. No bat involved, it would seem but that would have wandered down leg
good line from Moeen as he keeps it on off stump and doesn't give Finch the room he wants
flighted outside off, smeared into the covers
tossed up on off stump, Finch clips it behind square leg to keep moving on towards that ton
a bit short there and Bailey hammers it to deep square leg
shortish and outside off, cracked towards point
works it off his toes to find a single to the right of short midwicket

that's it! Leaps up and punches the air as Finch becomes the fourth Australian to get a century on World Cup debut with a flick to long leg. His home crowd, a big and loud and raucous crowd, show him lots of love. Lovely little stroke to get to the mark too. Epitomises the kind of innings he's played, aware of things and not just trusting his power
back of a length and outside off, tapped into the off side
straying on the pads and Finch works it behind square leg for a couple, gee he's run hard today!

and shots like that will promote it! What an off-drive! A touch overpitched from Finn and he is punished for it. Almost took his hands with it on the way to the boundary, if he had been able to reach it
good length on middle and leg, nudged towards the leg side
banged in short and Finch pulls on one-leg to deep square leg
slipping down leg and the deflection has Buttler excited after he dives to his left and completes a good take. But it's just off the pads
fuller and slower ball on off stump, works it through midwcket who sends in a direct throw but Bailey's well home. Root was the fielder, I think...
back of a lenght, lets it come on and runs it to point. Takes a few steps and has to run back and then apologise to his captain for his almost-mistake
stays beside the shortish ball on off stump and tries to beat point, Bell's too good there with a dive to his left
full and a shade wide of off stump, hammered towards mid-on.
fullish on off stump, nurdled to mid-on for a single
shortish and outside off, Bailey slaps it away to Jimmy at sweeper cover
good change of pace from Broad, reckon that's going to happen quite often. But Finch stood back and punched it to the left of mid-off. Morgan the fielder steps up there, I think
back of a length and outside off, tapped into the covers and Taylor wrings his fingers after fielding it
defends a shortish delivery on off stump
ties him down on off stump again, even with Finch attempting to make room. Broad's natural bounce helps him out there
fullish on off stump, Finch turns it to short midwicket and jogs off towards the drinks trolley
looks for the short one and Bailey gets a miscued pull to lob square leg
slower ball outside off, Finch plonks the open face on it and runs it to short third man
width on offer and Bailey will be disappointed at picking Finn out at short third man with his late cut. A few yards more to his right and that would have scampered off
prepares for a pull, then I wonder if he wanted to take evasive action. Whatever it was, he keeps the bat up and the short ball pings off it to long leg
well, well, well... batting powerplay actually helping the batsmen! It's a fuller delivery outside off and Bailey has slammed it over mid-off and Woakes curses his straying length
shortish on off stump, Bailey taps it towards short midwicket and sets off
fulllish on middle, Bailey reminds himself to bring down a straight bat and beats Anderson's desperate dive to his right
banged in short and Finch has clubbed it to deep midwicket

top-edge and it lands right in the middle of Ballance and another fielder, Broad from mid-on, running back from the circle. Had to drag the short ball away and he had committed to the stroke. Skews up for deep midwicket but neither fielder called and Ballance was worried about a collision, which is fair, Is that another opportunity lost?
shortish and outside off, slapped to point
banged in short and Ballance is back in the picture again with the batsman pulling violently
slower ball outside off, Finch runs it down to short third man
down the track and Finch manages to adjust for the change in length and slaps it to the left of short third man
reverse sweep, he's just showing off now! It was a good length ball, but Finch lunges at it and connects with scary force. Point had no chance, even if it was a feet to his left
orthodox sweep finds James Taylor at short fine leg, chance of a run-out with Finch wandering outside his crease. but the throw is too high
stays leg side of the ball to try and cut the ball that was cramping him for room through point. Beaten
phew! He's decided to stop worrying about 'what ifs' now. Playing with pure freedom as he lunges forward and slog sweeps a flighted delivery over midwicket
jumps outside off and hammers a Moeen short ball from the stumps to the deep point boundary. This is becoming very, very bad for England

shortish and outside off, drills a cut into the square and lobs it over point. Finch and Bailey are running hard, Broad races in from the boundary and sends in a throw that stings. So much so that Finn is toppled over as he receives it. Came in right at his face there. Poor bloke
short and a shade outside off, pulled or rather miscued to deep square leg
banged in short and Finch, having made room, has allowed it through to the keeper after knowing the slower bouncer has sailed over his head

direct hit from the captain and Finch is gone! England are pumped up! He backed away to slap the ball past short cover, Morgan moved to his left, took aim and nailed the target. Finch was not even in the frame. MCG rises to celebrate a wonderful innings, but he was walking off cursing himself. Finch really could have enjoyed himself with over 10 overs left. Ends up fifth on the highest individual score by an Australian in the World Cup
shortish and outside off, slid away to deep third man
short and wide outside off, Maxwell guides it to deep third man
short and wide again, Bailey whacks it to deep point
flighted on middle, whipped to deep midwicket
good length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to deep midwicket
clipped towards short fine leg and Taylor does not allow Bailey the single he wants with a good dive to his left
if Maxi's in there has to be a reverse sweep. Third ball he faces has been swatted over point quite emphatically
length ball on middle, Maxwell hammers a sweep to deep square leg
gets down the track and tickles a good length ball towards short fine leg

oh, he's gone now! Drags it on and England have got rid of the set batsmen. The fatal slice to point against a good length ball outside off ends up an inside edge to knock middle stump. Good, solid innings from Bailey. Australia needed that.
full on off stump, thumped back at Finn
fuller delivery outside off, left for the keeper
keeps to his crease against a back of a length ball on off stump, defended towards point
outside edge and it runs down to deep third man. Appeared to straighten a touch to pull Marsh to play away from his body a bit
back of a length on off stump, taps a runs in front of point
a good length ball on leg stump, turned towards midwicket
flighted on off stump, Marsh calmly knocks it to long-on

top-edge, but it falls too far fine of Taylor at short fine leg! Not quite the length to sweep and he got a little too far under the ball. Lobs up and stays in the air quite a while, but Taylor had no chance
lunges outside off and whips a good length ball towards square leg
goes back and across to flick a length delivery to long leg
tossed up on leg stump to try and beat the shuffling Maxwell, no such luck as he flicks to deep midwicket
shortish and cutting off his room on off stump, defended to point
sliding into the pads and Maxwell flicks it through deep midwicket. Moeen gets across to it but not before the batsmen take two
cuts back in sharply at Maxwell, who does well to soften his hands and let the shortish ball run off the open face to third man
shortish on off stump, defended into the covers
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off. Marsh seems to be taking his time to get in
a touch short and Marsh loads up for a front-foot pull, but Root is quite alert at short midwicket. Dives to his left to keep it to nothing. England desperate to build pressure here
has him and missing outside off. It was a good length delivery outside off, and gets it to straighten. Marsh follows it with an open face and misses
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off to get a quick single
opens the face to run a back of a length delivery towards point
fuller delivery on off stump, Maxwell blocks with an open face. Risky option considering the ball was full and straight
runs down the track and hammers a length ball from Broad over mid-on's head. Murderous strike from Maxwell, straight through the line of the cross-seamed ball
encore! Not quite off the middle, but there's enough bat on it to trickle to the long-on boundary again. Races down while making room for himself and benefits big time
and that's what happens when he takes a little time for himself. Finds an overpitched ball on off stump to his liking and bangs it down the ground past mid-on's left
swung around to long leg, looks like the charge has well and truly begun
slower ball bouncer and fools Maxwell into going for a pull too early. Gets struck on the elbow.
fuller delivery on middle and leg, clipped to long leg
slower and shorter on middle, Marsh pulls to long leg
full and slanted in at Maxwell, who was trying to make some room. Good bowling from Woakes as comes back after conceding an early boundary and keeps it to only a single towards point off the pads
seeks the yorker and follows Maxwell, who was moving to make some room for himself. Push into the covers amounts to nothing
banged in and it's slow in pace as well, Maxwell is irritated that he hasn't hit that better. Can only manage a single towards midwicket. Clever bowling
back of a length on off stump, pushed back to long-on
that's the quicker short ball and Maxwell's not ready for this either. Gets it high on the bat off the pull and scampers off for a single towards midwicket
fuller delivery on middle and leg, no room on offer from Anderson, and it's pushed to long-on

seeks the yorker, but strays by just a few inches and that's enough for Maxwell to stick his front leg aside and shovel it over the covers. Gets under it and powers it away with the strength of his forearms
goes short and Marsh has bludgeoned it wide of long-on! Decides he doens't want that front leg hampering him, picks up the offcutter and holds nothing back
gee, he has to adjust to the bounce on this delivery, and the lack of room on it and yet he has thumped a boundary straight down the ground.
slower ball, dug in short again. Marsh waits and pulls to deep square leg. Two easily taken
almost finds the yorker on middle, and curling in at Marsh too, flicked to deep midwicket
backs away to try and tonk a shortish delivery through the off side, but mistimes it to cover
gets just enough of a glove to beat the diving wicketkeeper and scurry along to the long leg boundary. Short-ball tactic is going horribly awry, especially the offcutter short balls like this one
length ball has done the trick! Marsh holes out at long-off! The crowd roars it Root's ears as he settles beneath the miscued forehand-slam from the batsman and takes it comfortably
fuller delivery outside off, hammered to long-off
short and wide, Maxwell barely needs to do much more than lift it over point. Poor bowling, no cover there.
dropped, I think by Buttler! It was back of a length, Maxwell seeks the pull off the front foot and gets a thick top edge. The keeper leaps up as high as he could, but can only palm it away

another four, this one far more emphatic. It was shortish again and Maxwell has slogged it to the long leg boundary. Fifty for the man and he salutes the crowd, dressing room and gives a thumbs up to the crowd as well. He's faced only 30 balls!
full on middle and leg, Maxwell clips it fine and enjoys a fourth boundary on the trot. Appears he's learned a game that is not solely reliant on power
makes some room and slices a good length ball to deep point to raise their 15th 300-plus score in the World Cup
follows Maxwell, who was wandering away outside leg. Good full length too, but the batsman is able to slug it to deep midwicket
backs away and telegraphs that intention to the bowler who almost nails a yorker, gets an inside edge to deep square leg
gives a full toss on leg stump and Haddin has directed it to deep square leg
a shade short is the back of the hand slower ball and has a little room attached to it and Haddin has rocked back and walloped it to the wide long-on boundary for 3000 ODI runs
full and seeking the toes of the batsmen, which are outside leg stump. Pushed to long-on
how well has he done that! Leaped away to the leg side to create his own room, saw third man up and slices it from the top of off stump to the third man boundary
full toss outside leg stump with Haddin making room of course, punched it to long-on for a couple. Good work from Ballance, that was well-timed
there's Broad's strength. Gets it to lift awkwardly even in the 48th over and beats a Haddin glide to third man. Goes for an appeal, but there was nothing on it
round two goes to Haddin! It was short on middle and he had moved outside leg to ramp the ball to the third man boundary. Why would they have short third man up for this line of attack?
finds the yorker on middle and leg, pushed to the right of the bowler for a single
banged in short and it sails over the swaying batsman's head, a loud chorous of boos ring around the MCG as Broad finishes a commendable spell
length ball, that's a no-no in this time of the innings and Haddin proves why as he moves outside leg and cracks it over cover.
back of the hand slower ball, and it's short in length too, Haddin knows there is no one on the off-side boundary, moves miles outside leg, and slices it to the third man boundary
full and outside leg, drilled to long-on
that's slower and shorter and Maxwell has thrown everything he has at it. Only for the ball to beat him and go through to the keeper
hits the yorker on the base of leg stump and keeps Maxwell to a dot.

length this time and Maxwell has cleared his front leg for a belt towards the long-on boundary. Finn is the man down there as he runs to his right and dives full length to try and catch it. May possibly have got a fingertip or two. Story of the day for England
tries to dupe Finn by moving to the leg side and is ready for it when Finn goes short and wide outside off, Lifts it over point and Broad pulls magnificent sliding save. Tests his knee after it
backs away to a length ball and hammers it over cover and it skims to the boundary. There's no stopping this riot
moves outside leg and clubs a shortish ball that cramps him to deep midwicket

swings and gets a thick outside edge that tests Broad at deep third man and he passes it with flying colours. Runs in, keeps his eyes all the way on it after Haddin looks for the boundary with a big slog as is necessary with only two balls left, he's played a little gem here

skews it down the ground and Root has taken an absolute blinder! It was full and speared in at the batsman's legs, credit to Maxwell to powering it that far down the ground but Root has made this wicket. Races to his right from long-off, dives full length and grabs it low with both hands. Text-book awesomeness!

at-trick for Finn, and a five- for! That's a third time a bowler has been two-in-two today and Finn is the only one to convert. It was back of a length, Johnson backed away and slapped it straight at mid-off. Has a wry smile on his face and the reason is that Australia have piled up 342!
